Test Description:
Create 8 volumes (mixed of simple, remote and mirrored ones) of different sizes. Attach, do fio write & verify pattern, detach, resize them to different sizes, attach, verify pattern, do fio write-pattern on extended region/offset of resized volume, verify pattern. 
Note :  Here grow the volumes such that following cases are covered : a) Only L1 blocks of LDs increase by few but no of L0s remain same, b) No of L0 blocks of LDs increase but no new SV added c) New SV(s) are added. 
Note : 
LDFS_BLOCK_SIZE = 4K
LDFS_BLOCKS_IN_ONE_L1 = 800
L1_BLOCKS_IN_ONE_L0 = 4K
L0_BLOCKS_IN_ONE_LD = 64
STRIPE_CNT = 4
a)        To add 1 L1 block in LDs of a volume, increase its size max by 12800K,
b)        To add 1 L0 block in LDs of a volume, increase its size by 4(stripe-cnt)* 4K(L1 entries in L0) * 800 (Data-block entries in L1) * 4K (ldfs block size) = 51200M
c)        To add 1 new SV in plex(es) of a volume, increase its size by SV size, i.e. 64 (max L0 blocks in a LD)*51200M = 3276800M

Create 8 volumes, attach, create FileSystem (mix of xfs, ext3) on them, mount, Write big files and compute their cheksums, Take note of FS size in output of (dumpe2fs -h or xfs_info cmd), unmount FS, detach volumes, resize them to different sizes (to cover a, b, c above), attach volumes, mount FS, resize FS (resize2fs or xfs_growfs cmd), dumpe2fs or xfs_info should show new size for the volumes, checksum of files written before resize should be same. Write files in grown area of FS and verify its working fine.

[Note : Copy GetFsSize(), GrowFs() routines from dev source base into e2e instead of reimplementing them].

Create 8 local volumes with different sizes [e.g Size in between 1G to 100G]. Write [Sequential] known pattern on entire volumes. Resize all volumes to 200Gi each. Verify pattern on volumes. Check storage reservations in "dctl cluster status" and "dctl drive list".
Repeat S_Resize_Basic_1.2 with mirrored volumes.

Scenario / Category: Resize the FS during subsequent volume attach if volume was grown after first use
Test Description: Steps : Create volume,  Create pod, Delete pod, Resize volume (using dctl volume update cmd), Create pod. Ensure device and FS size is consistent at this point
Resize single plex volumes. Add plexes to thes volumes. Check reservations in "dctl volume list", "dctl drive list", "dctl cluster status." Verify data on added plex.
Take snaphot of resized volume. Create lcv out of snapshot. Verify pattern on lcv.

Create N volumes (mirrored/non-mirrored) . Write known pattern on volumes. verify pattern written on volumes. Resize volumes. While volumes are resizing, reboot initiator node. Once node rejoins cluster, verify if volumes are resized or not. Verify pattern on volumes. Check storage reservations in "dctl cluster status" and "dctl drive list".

Create N volumes (mirrored). Write known pattern on volumes. verify pattern written on volumes. Resize volumes. While volumes are resizing, reboot target node. Once node rejoins cluster, verify if volumes are resized or not. Verify pattern on volumes. Check storage reservations in "dctl cluster status" and "dctl drive list".

Create N volumes (mirrored) . Write known pattern on volumes. verify pattern written on volumes. Resize volumes. Verify if volumes are resized or not. Verify pattern on volumes. Check storage reservations in "dctl cluster status" and "dctl drive list".  Reboot all nodes having plexes of the volume. Verify pattern on volumes. Verify reservations.

Scenario / Category: Resize Mirrored volume with detached plexes
Test Description: Create N mirrored volumes, attach, fio write-pattern, detach 1 or 2 plexes of volumes (by either link down or node down) during IOs, stop IOs, detach volume, resize volumes, attach volumes, do write-pattern on entire/extended_region of volumes. Bring up link/target-nodes. After resync completion, all plexes of the volume must be of same new size, must have same data.
Resize volume when bosun of initiator node is down.
Resize volume when bosun of target node is down.
Create local and mirrored volumes. Resize them beyond drive capacity.
Basic_resize TC could be run on same set of volumes multiple times
Use --fill_device.
ext2/3 has 16TB FS size limit, XFS has 100 TB, so try ext2/3

Scenario / Category: Just resizing volume should not change drive usage
Test Description: "sputil -i" should show same drive usage after resizing volumes until no new writes are done

Scenario / Category: Resize to max possible volume size
Test Description: Try to resize volume to max possible size/ 8T. Verify pattern. Verify reservations.
Resize to small or equal to current_size
Resize volumes when some of the plexes of the volume are in Resyncing state.
Try to resize non-existing volume.
Resize the volume when one of the target node is down. Try with single plex and mirrored volumes.

Create pods with  dynamically  provisioned local, remote and mirorred volumes [ Use volumeMode as FileSystem in storgae class].  Delete pods. Resize/expand volumes using csi driver. Recreate pods. Pods must go into running state.

Create pods with  dynamically  provisioned local, remote and mirorred volumes [ Use volumeMode as RawBlockDevice in storgae class].  Delete pods. Resize/expand volumes using csi driver. Recreate pods. Pods must go into running state.
Reboot node where external-resizer pod is running. Then trigger volume resize.  Once node rejoins cluster resize operation should be successful.
Power-off node where external-resizer pod is running. Then trigger volume resize. External-resizer pod should move to another node and eventualy resize operation should complete.

Create storage class by specifying "allowVolumeExpansion" false. Create persistent volume claim using created storage class. Create pod to consume this pvc. Delete pod. Try to resize volume, it should fail.
